lead_paragraph: Boy Scouts Jean Tuyishime and Moise Tuyikunde sit around a crackling campfire under a canopy of stars in Colorado's Rocky Mountains, joking and teasing each other as adolescent brothers tend to do. Only two and a half years ago, they were a world away living at the crowded Gihembe refugee camp, built on a sprawling and dusty expanse of land in northern Rwanda.

headline.main: Refugee Youths Find Safe Haven in Boy Scouts of America
headline.print_headline: Refugee Youths Find Safe Haven in Boy Scouts of America
